en: Call now; is there any that will answer thee? And to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?
hmr: “Tuhin ko ta; nanga hung dawn che an um hrim am? Mi inthieng a tu tieng am a na i nghakîr ding?

en: For vexation killeth the foolish man, And jealousy slayeth the silly one.
hmr: Lunginsenna chun mi invêt chu a sukhlumin, Îtthîkna chun mi intlâw chu a that hlak sih a.

en: I have seen the foolish taking root: But suddenly I cursed his habitation.
hmr: Mi invêt zungkei chu ka hmu tah a; Nisienlakhawm, a umna chu ṭawngsie kân phur nghâl hlak.

en: His children are far from safety, And they are crushed in the gate, Neither is there any to deliver them:
hmr: A thlahai chu himnaa inthawka hlatakah an um a, Dâi kawtkhâr bula chun râwtdein an um a; Anni sansuok dingin tukhawm an um bawk nawh.

en: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, And taketh it even out of the thorns; And the snare gapeth for their substance.
hmr: A lohmasuok chu phîngṭâm chun a fâk zo a, Hlinghai laia mi khawm chu a lâk suok hlak a; A thil neihai dingin châng chu ân kam zing hlak.

en: For affliction cometh not forth from the dust, Neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
hmr: Tuorna hi pilvut laia inthawkin a hung suok ngai si nawh a; Buoina khawm hi leihnuoia inthawkin a hung mâwng suok ngai bawk nawh;

en: But man is born unto trouble, As the sparks fly upward.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mihriem chu buoinaa hung pieng a ni lem, Meisihai chungtienga a vuong ang elin.

en: But as for me, I would seek unto God, And unto God would I commit my cause;
hmr: “Ka chungthua chun Pathien tieng zawng ka ta, Pathien kuomah ka chungthu chu inkawltir ka tih.

en: Who doeth great things and unsearchable, Marvellous things without number:
hmr: Thil ropuitakhai le zawng suok ruol lohai chu thawh a; Thil maktakhai tiem sêng lo thawtu chu.

en: Who giveth rain upon the earth, And sendeth waters upon the fields;
hmr: Ama chun hnuoi chungah ruo a hung pêk a; Loahai chun tuihai chu a hung tir bawk a:

en: So that he setteth up on high those that are low, And those that mourn are exalted to safety.
hmr: Mi inhnuoihai chu a dawm sâng a; Thlainvaihai chu himnaah a sie kai hlak.

en: He frustrateth the devices of the crafty, So that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
hmr: Themthiem remruotnahai chu a sukthlâwn a, Chuongchun, an kuthai chun an nuom zâwng chu a puitlin thei nawh.

en: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness; And the counsel of the cunning is carried headlong.
hmr: Mi varhai chu an var vervêknain a âwk a; Mi vervêkhai inrâwnna chu a letlingin a siem hlak.

en: They meet with darkness in the day-time, And grope at noonday as in the night.
hmr: Sûn huna chun inthimna leh an intuok a, Sûnchang lai zâna ang elin an inmai hlak.

en: But he saveth from the sword of their mouth, Even the needy from the hand of the mighty.
hmr: An baua kâwlhnâma inthawk chu fahrahai a sanhim a, Mi tlasamhai chu mi hrât kuta inthawkin a sansuok hlak.

en: So the poor hath hope, And iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi rimsi chun beiseina a hung nei a, Rîtlona chun a bau ân chîp tah a.

en: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: Therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty.
hmr: “Ngai ta, mi Pathienin a sukdik chu a va hlim de! Chuleiin, Iengkimthawthei thununna chu hmusit naw rawh.

en: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up; He woundeth, and his hands make whole.
hmr: Pânna a siem a, a tuom a, A sukhliem a, a kuthai chun a sukdam sih a.

en: He will deliver thee in six troubles; Yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
hmr: Buoina paruka inthawkin sansuok a ti cheh a, Anih, pasaria thil ṭha naw hrimin nang tâwk ta naw ni che.

en: In famine he will redeem thee from death; And in war from the power of the sword.
hmr: Ṭâm lai chun thinaa inthawkin sansuok a ti che a; Indo lai chun kâwlhnâm thilthawtheinaa inthawkin sansuok a ti che.

en: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue; Neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
hmr: Lei hrilsietnaa inthawk chun thuphmang nîng i ta; Sukbohmangna a hung tlung pha khawm ṭi bawk naw ti nih.

en: At destruction and dearth thou shalt laugh; Neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
hmr: Sukbohmangnaa le ṭâmnaa chun innui i ta, Hnuoi chunga sahrânghai khawm ṭi bawk naw ti nih.

en: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field; And the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
hmr: Rama lunghai le chun inthuruol tâng in ta; Rama sahrânghai khawm chu nang le inremin um tâng an tih.

en: And thou shalt know that thy tent is in peace; And thou shalt visit thy fold, and shalt miss nothing.
hmr: Chun, i puon in chu a râlmuong ti hrieng i ta; I ran in chu va sir i ta, iengkhawm inhmang naw nih.

en: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, And thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
hmr: I chithla chu a hung ropui ding a nih ti hre bawk i ta; I thlahai chu hnuoi chunga hlobet ang elin.

en: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, Like as a shock of grain cometh in in its season.
hmr: Kum tling zetin thlâna chun fêng i ta; Buvûi kuong chu a hun taka hrizâwla a hung um angin.

en: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; Hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
hmr: En ta hi, ei zawng suok ta hi, a lo ni ngei a nih; Ngai la, i ṭhatna dingin hung hre rawh,” tiin.
